org.araneaframework.uilib.form.constraint
Class NumberInRangeConstraint

java.lang.Object
  org.araneaframework.uilib.form.constraint.BaseConstraint
      org.araneaframework.uilib.form.constraint.BaseFieldConstraint
          org.araneaframework.uilib.form.constraint.NumberInRangeConstraint
All Implemented Interfaces:
Constraint, Serializable
public class NumberInRangeConstraint
extends BaseFieldConstraint

This constraint checks that the number value would be inside a given range.

Author:
Jevgeni Kabanov (ekabanov at araneaframework dot org)
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

NumberInRangeConstraint

public NumberInRangeConstraint()
A constructor that expects constraint settings to be specified after initialization.

NumberInRangeConstraint

public NumberInRangeConstraint(FormElement field)
A constructor that binds given constraint to a form field. The ranges should be provided using setRangeStart(BigInteger) and setRangeEnd(BigInteger).

Parameters:
field - The form element that this constraint should be bound to.

NumberInRangeConstraint

public NumberInRangeConstraint(BigInteger start,
                               BigInteger end)
A constructor that initializes the range limits. The latter ones also accept null values.

Of course, the start value should be less than end value, or the validation would fail.

Parameters:
start - The start value of the range.
end - The end value of the range.
Method Detail

validateConstraint

protected void validateConstraint()
Checks that the number value would be inside a given range.

Specified by:
validateConstraint in class BaseConstraint

setRangeStart

public void setRangeStart(BigInteger rangeStart)
Sets the start value of the range.

Parameters:
rangeStart - The start value of the range.

setRangeEnd

public void setRangeEnd(BigInteger rangeEnd)
Sets the end value of the range.

Parameters:
rangeEnd - The end value of the range.
